DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of the trial is to compare efficacy and adverse effects of pulsed dye laser and intense pulsed light in patients with port wine stains.
DOC.brief_title: Treatment of Naevus Flammeus Using Intense Pulsed Light and Pulsed Dye Laser
DOC.criteria: Patients with previously untreated and previously lasertreated naevus flammeus. Naevus flammeus measuring at least 5 x 7 cm within a single anatomical area. For example, the face corresponding to dermatomes V1, V2 and V3, back, abdomen, arms and legs.Patients aged two or above.Patients with skin types IIII. Patients below two years of age. Pregnant or breastfeeding patients. Patients with known increased sensitivity to visible light. Patients with a tendency to produce hypertrophic scars or celoids. Patients with skin types IV, V and VI. Patients who are clearly pigmented following recent exposure to the sun or a solarium. Patients treated with Roaccutane during the last six months. Patients who are not considered able to follow the treatment protocol (e.g. severely alcoholic patients, dementia patients, mentally ill patients, etc.).
